intro: Alansmia lobulata, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Alansmia lobulata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
